meanings.definition: A group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The wadies gathered around the campfire for stories.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to form wadies to work on the project.
meanings.sent3: The wadies of colorful birds chirped happily in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The wadies of stars twinkled in the night sky like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The wadies of flowers bloomed beautifully in the garden.

meanings.definition: To move in a casual or leisurely manner.
meanings.sent1: She wadies along the beach, enjoying the sound of the waves.
meanings.sent2: The cat wadies lazily across the room, stretching its paws.
meanings.sent3: He wadies through the park, stopping to watch the ducks in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The clouds wadies across the sky, casting shadows on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The river wadies gently through the valley, reflecting the sunlight.
